community has mainly landed on a different approach and that's called subscriptions so subscriptions are based
on events so whereas with request/response so in a query like we
saw earlier there was one query and you get one response what we're doing with a subscription is registering our interest
in zero or more occurrences of some event at some point in the future so we
don't get a response back instantly but we will get it back potentially at some point in the future so to be clear these
are really powerful they're not a replacement for queries but as you'll see when used appropriately they can
